intro: Hypseocharis malpasensis, commonly known as the Malpas lily, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Alstroemeriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions with cool climates. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and it produces a single, showy bloom per stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
